critique: The document is an executive order aimed at combating what it describes as "offensive and anti-American race and sex stereotyping and scapegoating" in federal workplaces, the Uniformed Services, and among federal contractors and grant recipients. It defines "divisive concepts" and prohibits the promotion of such concepts in training programs. The order asserts that certain diversity and inclusion training programs promote racial stereotypes and division, undermining merit principles and potentially threatening the cohesion of the Uniformed Services. It directs agencies to review grant programs and ensure federal funds are not used to promote these concepts. It also directs the Attorney General and the Equal Employment Opportunity Commission to assess whether workplace training that teaches these divisive concepts may contribute to a hostile work environment and give rise to potential liability under Title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964.
